item.title: Sweep Control v1.1.0.10
item.description:
Product: Sweep Control v1.1.0.10
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Tue, 06 May 2025 06:28:06 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: [SweepControl.lvclass]
- Sweep Control.vi:
- Sequencer for stepping multiple parameters. Calls VIs in Transport.lvclass
- Continuous B sweep.vi:
- Sweep B continuously while asynchronously calling VIs in Transport.lvclass

Release Notes: [1.2.0]
- - #93/#94: Updates related to Instrument Framework
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Transport v1.9.0.11
item.description:
Product: Transport v1.9.0.11
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Mon, 05 May 2025 20:25:05 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Transport.lvclass]
Basic transport measurments:
- Lockin vs time (Lockin_time.vi)
- Lockin Sweep Mode (Lockin_sweep.vi)

Release Notes: [1.9.0]
- #93/#94: Updates related to Instrument Framework
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Control Experiment v1.2.0.10
item.description:
Product: Control Experiment v1.2.0.10
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Mon, 05 May 2025 19:50:37 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Control Experiment.lvclass]
- Control Experiment.vi
- provides a uniform way to record information about your sample & device
- record how the lockin is connected to the device
- configure the Krohn Hite amplifier
- set the base path for saving data
- configure peripheral instruments
- APIs for recording sample data, instrument status

Release Notes: [1.2.0]
- #95: Fix bug in Dictionaries that would not support writing integer data types
- #93/#94: Updates related to Instrument Framework
- remove unit tests from source folder
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.15.1.34
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.15.1.34
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Sun, 04 May 2025 15:36:56 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Framework for communicating with hardware (Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

Release Notes: [1.15.1]
- updated package dependencies
item.dc:creator: LevyLab
